subject: Leadership
title: Naturalistic Decision-Making
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Naturalistic Decision-Making.

hook.text: Firefighters don't weigh pros and cons in a burning building. They recognize patterns and act. So should you.

buildup.text: Klein's Recognition-Primed Decision model: experts match the current situation to past experience and simulate outcomes.

discovery.text: RPD skips option comparison. The first workable solution is tested mentally. If it holds, they act immediately.

twist.text: This only works with experience. Novice leaders default to analysis paralysis or reckless guessing.

climax.text: Build your pattern library: study past crises, run tabletop exercises, and debrief every incident thoroughly.

punchline.text: Experts don't think faster. They recognize faster.

quiz.question: What is the core of Klein's RPD model?
options: Matching the situation to past patterns and simulating outcomes
